Well structured, competitive and fun game. However, CSGO environment has became toxic with the never ending waves of hackers. Don't bother to spend money in this game or consider buying premium since CSGO has no permanent solution towards the hackers so the game is very unfair and no fun when there's hackers.

Game is overall a great game depending on many factors, which i will go over in this review. To start with this isn't a game you can just jump into and be #1, it takes a lot of practice, time and commitment. Overall i've played this game for 2,400+ hours combined between my multiple accounts. I have personally loved this game for what it has to offer and have always been a fan of the game-mode and the genre of the game.

I will be going over the positives and negatives in this review as well as summing it up at the end with my overall thoughts and opinions. I will admit this game isn't for the light hearted, as the community is a fairly toxic but also pleasant community. I have made many friends but also dealt with a lot of childish players within this game. You will be able to make friends quite easily and play with them constantly making it easier to rank up as your playing with people you can communicate with rather then random people.

There are a few key points to this game that make it amazing those are, team work, communication, skill, knowledge and memory. Team work is a vital part of this game and is what makes it amazing, it's a lot harder to win when you aren't playing as a team, any great team requires great communication, communication is an important part, as well as knowing what to call and when to call it. This game requires some skill, at the higher levels a lot more skill. This doesn't necessarily mean you need to be the best, as there are ranks in competitive for a reason to assign you to people in similar ranks, although there are smurfs and cheaters as with any competitive game. Knowledge and memory go together, can't have one without the other in this game, you need to be knowledgeable in how to peek, where to peek, how to peek together and more similar situations, to top it off you also need good memory in where to smoke, how to smoke certain positions, as well as flashbangs and other utilities.

In saying that, that is mainly only the competitive side of this game, there are many other amazing features offered in this game, those being community servers, arms races, demolition, casual and other gamemodes. This game has a lot to offer, in particular one of my favourite parts of this game is the community servers, you have surf servers, and game servers, making it a game for everyone.

If you are feeling like taking your gaming to the next level i would highly recommend this game, there are many leagues to join i.e FaceIT and similar. There is also the pro scene which many make it to in different divisions, this allows for the best of the best to play for cash and other rewards.

This game has no real pay to win features besides when the game requires you to now pay for prime, which is totally worth it! There are skins, but those do not have any advantage besides player models which can make it harder to see the person which is playing.

Now i will give you all a lovely bullet point list of what this has to offer quickly ran down with negatives and positives below:

The Negatives:
1) The Community - This will be featured in both areas, as it is a downfall and a positive, the community can be quite toxic but also quite welcoming.
2) Learning Curve - There is a learning curve for this game, so don't expect to jump in and be rambo.
3) The Cheaters - This comes with any game, but in this game there is a chance you will run into cheaters quite frequently.

The Positives:
1) Amazing Game - This game is always going to be a top game and very popular at that.
2) Requires Co-operation - This game i personally enjoy for the fact it requires the team to work as a team.
3) Fun Combat - The guns have recoil patterns to learn, getting a good one tap is quite fun. Overall combat is a great aspect of this game.
4) Top Selling Game - This game is a top selling game for a reason, allowing all sorts of players from all over to play an amazing FPS.

Thats the good and bad quickly summed up, i will be updating this review as time goes on. I hope you all enjoyed and if you have any questions feel free to leave them below and I will get to you as soon as i can. If you are looking for a game to have some fun then this is the game for you, aslong as you know what your in for. Hope you all have a lovely day and keep on fragging!

While I have a lot of love for CS:GO, and have spent a good amount of time playing, I seriously have a hard time recommending it to anyone [i] new [/i]. The game has a serious and ongoing hacker and smurfing problem, and even if someone isn't cheating, it's hard to play against anyone good without seriously questioning if they are using some kind of third party cheat. The game is fun to play about half of the time.

I am definitely no where near top skill in this game, I only place GN, but it's hard to play competitively or even just for fun at all anymore when you always have to live in fear of someone cheating the system to ruin your day. While obviously not every match you place into is going to have a cheater or a smurf, after playing for long such matches appear enough to tarnish the whole experience.

I still won't recommend you play Valorant though.

I started playing CSGO a while back and basically play war games to get the yearly badge.  I'm not the greatest and I know there are players better than me, but when you have a player running up the stairs and they shoot you while their back is to you and kill you, something is going on.  Or you have another player who takes on 3 players of the enemy team and mows them down like nothing and continues playing.  Also, the AFKers who are continually dragged from one match to another (and no, they aren't turning in circles, they are just standing there) and their friends won't kick them, something needs to be done about this.

But the worse thing is the people with a high ping (over 150 or more) when the rest of the players are at 15-40 ping.  Why are these people even allowed to join these matches.  Also, with all the thousands of people in this game, why do I continually get placed with the same 7-10 players where I can't get kills because either my teammates or the other team are getting 16 - 22 headshots or more?  I left the game once and didn't play for six months, but I'm just after the badge, but finding it may not be worth it as Valve's anti-cheat isn't very effective.

Question to Steam support:

Hello. Please tell me how I can accomplish achievements: 1) Veteran of map Aztec, 2) Veteran of map Dust , 3) Veteran of map Shorttrain, 4) This Glass World, 5) Sniper, 6) Tourist when you removed these 3 maps, thereby making these achievements unworkable. I hope to hear an adequate answer from you, since I really do not understand what the problem is: you have deleted maps, delete achievements, do not want to delete achievements, add maps back. + The game is actively supported by developers, updates are coming out. I encounter such a problem for the first time and for my understanding it is nonsense when game developers remove game content so plus tied to achievements. I perform all games on 100% ONLY HONESTLY and how can I perform these achievements when they are broken?

Answer from Steam support:

We are currently aware that certain achievements are no longer able to be obtained due to the maps being removed from the game. Unfortunately, we cannot provide a workaround for obtaining these achievements but I have forwarded your concerns on this matter onto the CS:GO team so they're aware. 

Please let us know if you have any other questions or issues that we may assist you with.

My opinion:

The developer has done nothing since 2017 when they have broken these 6 achievement. Maybe it is new fashion, break something that is working good. I want you to know only one thing if you ignore the quality of your project remember that this is the way to nowhere. I hope that there is at least 1 person in your development team who understands and will correct this problem.

About the game:

The very good game. Didn't meet any bugs. The game engine gives us the very good picture. Physic in the game done on highest level.

Вопрос к Steam support:

Здравствуйте. Скажите пожалуйста, как я могу выполнить достижения: 1) Ветеран карты Aztec, 2) Ветеран карты Dust, 3) Ветеран карты Shorttrain, 4) Этот стеклянный мир, 5) Снайпер, 6) Турист, когда Вы удалили эти 3 карты, тем самым сделали нерабочими эти достижения. Надеюсь услышать от Вас адекватный ответ, так как мне собственно вообще не понятно в чем проблема: удалили карты, удаляйте достижения, не хотите удалять достижения, добавляйте карты назад. + Игра активно поддерживается разработчиками, выходят обновления. С такой проблемой я сталкиваюсь впервые и для моего понимания это нонсенс когда разработчики игры удаляют игровой контент так плюс привязанный к достижениям. Я выполняю все игры на 100% ТОЛЬКО ЧЕСТНЫМ ПУТЕМ и как я могу выполнить эти достижения когда они сломаны?

Ответ от Steam support:

В настоящее время мы знаем, что некоторые достижения больше не могут быть получены из-за удаления карт из игры. К сожалению, мы не можем предоставить обходной путь для получения этих достижений, но я направил ваши опасения по этому вопросу в команду CS: GO, чтобы они знали.

Пожалуйста, дайте нам знать, если у вас есть какие-либо другие вопросы или проблемы, с которыми мы можем вам помочь.

Мое мнение:

Разработчик ничего не делал с 2017 года, когда они сломали эти 6 достижений. Может, это новая мода, сломать то, что работает хорошо. Я хочу, чтобы вы знали только одно, если вы игнорируете качество вашего проекта помните, что это путь в никуда. Надеюсь, что в вашей команде разработчиков есть хотя бы 1 человек, который понимает и исправит эту проблему.

Об игре:

Очень хорошая игра. Не встречал никаких багов. Игровой движок дает нам очень хорошую картину. Физика в игре сделана на самом высоком уровне.

I was born in 1967. My name is Owen and my mother's name was Beth and my father's name was Stefan. My mother was a house wife while my father worked in the coal mines down town. We lived in Adelaide and for most of our lives we were a happy family. I had two siblings, both brothers. One day, my older brother passed away, shortly after my father died. It was a very melancholy period of time for the whole family and struggled to survive. One day, my younger brother came back from school. He has a paper bag filled with something which he shook around. It sounded like a bunch of pebbles or something small and in large capacity. He came and offer me some of the contents of the bag. It was nuts (as in the food). I had never before had nuts and I asked how he got a hang of them since at the time they were quite expensive and we didn't have the capital to afford such a luxury. He said he got them from his friend Deez. I then asked, who Deez was. Ever since that day I have lived in a constant state of misery and despair, wishing that I had the strength to take my own life, but I am far too weak.

I have a few words to say about this cock and balls torture simulator disguised as a game. 
Your first 50 hours of this game will be riddled by nothing but pure rage as you encounter mainly cheaters and teammates so toxic that the Chernobly reactor 4 looks like an air refreshner besides them.

Overall... the second you play the first two matches, thats it... youve lost everything, seriously, forgot about everything else, this game is so addictive that it makes heroin look like green tea. 
Still... the fun you experience, and the feeling when you realize youre actually getting better is irreplacable. 
This game has given me nothing but pain, and you should definitely not play it

Just got CS GO today! AWP seems very OP...

Hello folks, just got the game today from the steam sale. Not completely new to CS, I've owned CSS for a few years now but only because it was on sale bundled with gmod which is what I was really after, though still a fun game that I'd play a few times a month.

Once thing I've noticed about almost every CSS server I've played on is every sniper but the Scout is banned, for good reason I thought since when I went into servers where they weren't banned no one was using anything but these weapons (mostly the AWP). In a game about making twitch precision headshots, the AWP seems to break it since you don't need to be very precise with it at all.

My experience with the AWP in CSS is actually why I've put off buying CS GO for so long. I knew that you get into most games through matchmaking meaning you have to deal with AWPS, and I feared most games would be reduced to everyone using AWPS vs everyone using AWPS, with people not using AWPS gettings shit on unless they're miles better than the enemy team. I ended up buying the game anyway today though since it's cheap and very popular.

Turns out my fears were completely justified. The AWP completely breaks the game. All skill goes out the window once you can afford an AWP, just take a seat and anyone who approaches you instantly dies. Honestly I'm really disappointing and I'm already starting to regret this purchase, since I have a lot more fun in CSS where there are mostly no AWPS.

Does anyone else feel the same way about this weapon? I feel like the game would be so much better off without it. This one weapon is so game breaking that most CSS servers ban it, and this single weapon alone being legal has discouraged me from buying this entire game. I'm sure at the top 5% of play AWPS are balanced and natural part of the game... and CS elitists are going to have a field day with my "noobish" complaints, but honestly I don't give a shit :\ because 95% of players aren't the top 5%.

Si hay algo por lo que Counter-Strike ha destacado tantísimo y sigue siendo tan reconocido, es por ser un juego de habilidad al 100%. Aquí no hay lugar para el factor suerte, obviamente dejando de lado al timing. El juego siempre ofrece las mismas herramientas a todos los jugadores, por lo que al final casi siempre acaban ganando los que mejor saben jugar. Olvídense de cualquier FPS moderno y todas sus innovaciones. Aquí las horas de juego se traducen en más experiencia "real", somos mejores porque al jugar más hemos aprendido sus mecánicas, el funcionamiento de las armas y los puntos estratégicos del mapa, pensar en lo que puede o no puede hacer el enemigo, no porque un sistema nos dé ventajas artificiales.

Para los nuevos jugadores, les digo que si juegan este nuevo campo de batalla y vienen de otros Shooters actuales como Call of Duty, lo mejor que pueden hacer es olvidar todo lo que han aprendido en esos juegos. Aquí se dispara desde la cadera y si quieres apuntar solo podrás hacerlo con las armas que tengan zoom; no hay regeneración de vida automática, por lo que todo el daño que recibamos será permanente, y no existen reapariciones, por lo que si nos matan no volveremos a la acción hasta la siguiente ronda (dejando dm y carrera de armamento de lado)

Básicamente, el juego nos propone unirnos al equipo de los terroristas (tt) o al de los anti-terroristas (ct). Dependiendo del mapa en el que nos encontremos, los terroristas tendrán que poner una bomba y detonarla o los anti-terroristas tendrán que rescatar a unos rehenes. Todo esto dentro del límite de tiempo fijado. Para ganar tenemos o que cumplir el objetivo o matar a todo el equipo contrario. Fácil, simple de entender, y con una profundidad jugable que ha marcado una época.


Si vamos correteando por ahí disparando a lo loco y contando con que acertaremos alguna bala, acabaremos muertos una y otra vez. Si queremos sobrevivir tendremos que estar constantemente pendientes del radar, jugar en equipo con el resto de nuestros compañeros, saber que si llevamos el cuchillo correremos más, tender emboscadas para agarrar por sorpresa, ser conscientes de que cuando estemos agachados mejoramos nuestra precisión, calcular muy bien cuando recargar, etc.

Además, cada ronda iremos ganando dinero, ya sea por matar rivales, ganar, perder, rescatar rehenes o desactivar bombas. Esto nos servirá para comprar armas y equipo en una tienda (la cual ahora presenta un aspecto radial para facilitar su uso con un mando) que hay en el punto de salida de cada equipo. Esto añade cierto valor estratégico, ya que tendremos qué decidir en qué gastar nuestros billetes en cada ronda. Además, si morimos, perderemos todo lo que hayamos adquirido, por lo que sobrevivir a cada asalto se convierte en algo todavía más valioso y que nos empuja a no cometer locuras y a medir bien nuestros movimientos.

Overall rating: 6/10.

The bottom four ranks of this game's matchmaking are more difficult than the top four ranks. Ranking up and down is also completely broken; my record is 13 wins consecutively with no rank up, keeping in mind each match is usually at least 45 minutes long. I used to love this game, its probably my most played game, but now its an unenjoyable experience all-together. The game with the largest and most view pro-league has quite possibly the worst ranking system for its amateur players. I have around 200 hours in siege and am ranked high platinum, yet have never made it past nova master in cs. This has turned into a rant, so in conclusion, if you like smurfs and a completely unfriendly player base, this is the game for you.

The game pits two teams, Terrorists and Counter-Terrorists, against each other in different objective-based game modes. The most common game modes involve the Terrorists planting a bomb while Counter-Terrorists attempt to stop them, or Counter-Terrorists attempting to rescue hostages that the Terrorists have captured. There are nine official game modes, all of which have distinct characteristics specific to that mode. The game also has matchmaking support that allows players to play on dedicated Valve servers, in addition to community-hosted servers with custom maps and game modes. A battle-royale game-mode, "Danger Zone", was introduced in December 2018.

P.S. The 2 things that made me a better player is lowering my sensitivity to around 1000 eDPI (DPI multiplied by in-game sens) and learning crosshair placement. Also, never hold an angle super tight. Always anticipate an enemy running out, and by the time you react, they have already left your crosshair.

The ideas behind Counter-Strike in general are great, but it's pretty obvious that this game can't ever live up to its potential.

1. The ranking system is broken. See the Leetify graphs of NA rank distribution. With a positive win rate, I'm still deranking, even on one loss after a winstreak. Back in 2015, the system pushed everyone to the top ranks; now in 2021, we're all being pushed to the lower ranks.
2. Cheaters are all over the place. This is the worst it's ever been. I have never seen a worse state of CSGO. The anticheat systems don't clean the game up. You run into match after match of blatant cheaters. It does not feel like the exception; it feels like the rule. Indeed, some days I haven't even had a clean match based on how many of my prior matches have a convicted cheater in them. You have to play 3rd party (ie. FACEIT) in order to have a chance at cleaner games, but even then I've run into obvious wallers.

[b]TL;DR: I do NOT recommend CSGO anymore in its current state. Do NOT spend anymore money on this game unless you're fine with the status quo. It's a terrible experience for new players, and the veterans are hanging on to their memories of what it used to be.[/b]

I'm sorry but CS:GO is no longer fun for me after nearly 3k hours (yes I know that's a long time. However, a majority of that time spent has been in casual matches due to only being able to solo queue). As for the game itself it can be good fun just to dive straight into a server and get the satisfaction of tapping heads.

However for both casual and competitive matches [i]it really is[/i] no place for anyone wanting to queue solo and, of course, it can be the same for other multiplayer games but not as bad as this game; that's for sure. As a prime example you most definitely and unfortunately will come across a player that will cheat as well as players that may not understand English which makes it a worse experience since communication is [b]key[/b] to truly work together as a team.

In addition to that, you may also either be matched up with players who are unfriendly and not showing good sportsmanship which only encourages negative mentality and stops you from fully focusing on the match.

Also I would like to mention, and I'm sure many people know this already, that this game also contains quite a few bugs such as not being able to hit a player whilst standing still and / or crouching aiming at their head. In other words, it's not consistently smooth gameplay.

[b]My advice to anyone wanting to play this game is only do so if you absolutely want to take it seriously and [i]really[/i] wanting to improve your overall performance whilst queuing with at least maybe 3 friends that you know well enough then move onto playing on 128-tick servers on 3rd party services such as FaceIt and / or ESEA.[/b]

After 8 years playing it, I didn't improve my skills in-game.

However, I learned new language skills: now I can curse in Russian and Brazilian Portuguese.

Also, my tolerance level to guttural screams and loud sounds was increased.

Now I can bear the crying of my children for longer and I can make them feel better by singing sweet traditional songs from other cultures, such as Очи чёрные (Dark Eyes) or Garota de Ipanema (The Girl from Ipanema).

In conclusion, Counter Strike transformed me into a better father and a better person, in addition to making me more patient, tolerant to hateful people and more trained in languages and cultures.

I hate this stupid fucking game. Relative to modern shooters it is worse in about every aspect imaginable. 50% of the time no matter what your trust factor is you will get put in a game with a cheater, and you can't do anything but get an ass whooping for 40 minutes or abandon the match and get a competitive ban. What's worse is the fact that they have removed bots from competitive for LITERALLY no reason so an enemy team has no insentive to kick their cheater. That is, if they could even kick them. Not even an hour ago I was against a queue where 3 people were partied together blatantly walling and bhop scripting on mirage. My entire team played the game dead silent not even shooting at people most of the time. This game has been on a downwards slope for years and now genuinely makes me want to go back to source and/or 1.6. If you want to play this game competitively then you have to do it through a 3rd party org who will most likely pay for you to have a reasonable experience. At that point you may be thinking, this game should be alright now right? Wrong. High level faceit is mostly full of closet cheaters who play the game to win tournament money. This game is so fucking far into the abyss that I don't even see how Valve can fix it. They finally made it where you have to pay for prime now. That must be a step in the right direction right? Sure, but the hundreds of thousands of free accounts who got to level 21 using cheats got grandfathered in. I really hope Valve can salvage this game because they are doing so little over so long (and boy do I mean so so so long).

Well structured, competitive and fun game. However, CSGO environment has became toxic with the never ending waves of hackers. Don't bother to spend money in this game or consider buying premium since CSGO has no permanent solution towards the hackers so the game is very unfair and no fun when there's hackers.

Game is overall a great game depending on many factors, which i will go over in this review. To start with this isn't a game you can just jump into and be #1, it takes a lot of practice, time and commitment. Overall i've played this game for 2,400+ hours combined between my multiple accounts. I have personally loved this game for what it has to offer and have always been a fan of the game-mode and the genre of the game.

I will be going over the positives and negatives in this review as well as summing it up at the end with my overall thoughts and opinions. I will admit this game isn't for the light hearted, as the community is a fairly toxic but also pleasant community. I have made many friends but also dealt with a lot of childish players within this game. You will be able to make friends quite easily and play with them constantly making it easier to rank up as your playing with people you can communicate with rather then random people.

There are a few key points to this game that make it amazing those are, team work, communication, skill, knowledge and memory. Team work is a vital part of this game and is what makes it amazing, it's a lot harder to win when you aren't playing as a team, any great team requires great communication, communication is an important part, as well as knowing what to call and when to call it. This game requires some skill, at the higher levels a lot more skill. This doesn't necessarily mean you need to be the best, as there are ranks in competitive for a reason to assign you to people in similar ranks, although there are smurfs and cheaters as with any competitive game. Knowledge and memory go together, can't have one without the other in this game, you need to be knowledgeable in how to peek, where to peek, how to peek together and more similar situations, to top it off you also need good memory in where to smoke, how to smoke certain positions, as well as flashbangs and other utilities.

In saying that, that is mainly only the competitive side of this game, there are many other amazing features offered in this game, those being community servers, arms races, demolition, casual and other gamemodes. This game has a lot to offer, in particular one of my favourite parts of this game is the community servers, you have surf servers, and game servers, making it a game for everyone.

If you are feeling like taking your gaming to the next level i would highly recommend this game, there are many leagues to join i.e FaceIT and similar. There is also the pro scene which many make it to in different divisions, this allows for the best of the best to play for cash and other rewards.

This game has no real pay to win features besides when the game requires you to now pay for prime, which is totally worth it! There are skins, but those do not have any advantage besides player models which can make it harder to see the person which is playing.

Now i will give you all a lovely bullet point list of what this has to offer quickly ran down with negatives and positives below:

The Negatives:
1) The Community - This will be featured in both areas, as it is a downfall and a positive, the community can be quite toxic but also quite welcoming.
2) Learning Curve - There is a learning curve for this game, so don't expect to jump in and be rambo.
3) The Cheaters - This comes with any game, but in this game there is a chance you will run into cheaters quite frequently.

The Positives:
1) Amazing Game - This game is always going to be a top game and very popular at that.
2) Requires Co-operation - This game i personally enjoy for the fact it requires the team to work as a team.
3) Fun Combat - The guns have recoil patterns to learn, getting a good one tap is quite fun. Overall combat is a great aspect of this game.
4) Top Selling Game - This game is a top selling game for a reason, allowing all sorts of players from all over to play an amazing FPS.

Thats the good and bad quickly summed up, i will be updating this review as time goes on. I hope you all enjoyed and if you have any questions feel free to leave them below and I will get to you as soon as i can. If you are looking for a game to have some fun then this is the game for you, aslong as you know what your in for. Hope you all have a lovely day and keep on fragging!

While I have a lot of love for CS:GO, and have spent a good amount of time playing, I seriously have a hard time recommending it to anyone [i] new [/i]. The game has a serious and ongoing hacker and smurfing problem, and even if someone isn't cheating, it's hard to play against anyone good without seriously questioning if they are using some kind of third party cheat. The game is fun to play about half of the time.

I am definitely no where near top skill in this game, I only place GN, but it's hard to play competitively or even just for fun at all anymore when you always have to live in fear of someone cheating the system to ruin your day. While obviously not every match you place into is going to have a cheater or a smurf, after playing for long such matches appear enough to tarnish the whole experience.

I still won't recommend you play Valorant though.

I started playing CSGO a while back and basically play war games to get the yearly badge.  I'm not the greatest and I know there are players better than me, but when you have a player running up the stairs and they shoot you while their back is to you and kill you, something is going on.  Or you have another player who takes on 3 players of the enemy team and mows them down like nothing and continues playing.  Also, the AFKers who are continually dragged from one match to another (and no, they aren't turning in circles, they are just standing there) and their friends won't kick them, something needs to be done about this.

But the worse thing is the people with a high ping (over 150 or more) when the rest of the players are at 15-40 ping.  Why are these people even allowed to join these matches.  Also, with all the thousands of people in this game, why do I continually get placed with the same 7-10 players where I can't get kills because either my teammates or the other team are getting 16 - 22 headshots or more?  I left the game once and didn't play for six months, but I'm just after the badge, but finding it may not be worth it as Valve's anti-cheat isn't very effective.

Question to Steam support:

Hello. Please tell me how I can accomplish achievements: 1) Veteran of map Aztec, 2) Veteran of map Dust , 3) Veteran of map Shorttrain, 4) This Glass World, 5) Sniper, 6) Tourist when you removed these 3 maps, thereby making these achievements unworkable. I hope to hear an adequate answer from you, since I really do not understand what the problem is: you have deleted maps, delete achievements, do not want to delete achievements, add maps back. + The game is actively supported by developers, updates are coming out. I encounter such a problem for the first time and for my understanding it is nonsense when game developers remove game content so plus tied to achievements. I perform all games on 100% ONLY HONESTLY and how can I perform these achievements when they are broken?

Answer from Steam support:

We are currently aware that certain achievements are no longer able to be obtained due to the maps being removed from the game. Unfortunately, we cannot provide a workaround for obtaining these achievements but I have forwarded your concerns on this matter onto the CS:GO team so they're aware. 

Please let us know if you have any other questions or issues that we may assist you with.

My opinion:

The developer has done nothing since 2017 when they have broken these 6 achievement. Maybe it is new fashion, break something that is working good. I want you to know only one thing if you ignore the quality of your project remember that this is the way to nowhere. I hope that there is at least 1 person in your development team who understands and will correct this problem.

About the game:

The very good game. Didn't meet any bugs. The game engine gives us the very good picture. Physic in the game done on highest level.

Вопрос к Steam support:

Здравствуйте. Скажите пожалуйста, как я могу выполнить достижения: 1) Ветеран карты Aztec, 2) Ветеран карты Dust, 3) Ветеран карты Shorttrain, 4) Этот стеклянный мир, 5) Снайпер, 6) Турист, когда Вы удалили эти 3 карты, тем самым сделали нерабочими эти достижения. Надеюсь услышать от Вас адекватный ответ, так как мне собственно вообще не понятно в чем проблема: удалили карты, удаляйте достижения, не хотите удалять достижения, добавляйте карты назад. + Игра активно поддерживается разработчиками, выходят обновления. С такой проблемой я сталкиваюсь впервые и для моего понимания это нонсенс когда разработчики игры удаляют игровой контент так плюс привязанный к достижениям. Я выполняю все игры на 100% ТОЛЬКО ЧЕСТНЫМ ПУТЕМ и как я могу выполнить эти достижения когда они сломаны?

Ответ от Steam support:

В настоящее время мы знаем, что некоторые достижения больше не могут быть получены из-за удаления карт из игры. К сожалению, мы не можем предоставить обходной путь для получения этих достижений, но я направил ваши опасения по этому вопросу в команду CS: GO, чтобы они знали.

Пожалуйста, дайте нам знать, если у вас есть какие-либо другие вопросы или проблемы, с которыми мы можем вам помочь.

Мое мнение:

Разработчик ничего не делал с 2017 года, когда они сломали эти 6 достижений. Может, это новая мода, сломать то, что работает хорошо. Я хочу, чтобы вы знали только одно, если вы игнорируете качество вашего проекта помните, что это путь в никуда. Надеюсь, что в вашей команде разработчиков есть хотя бы 1 человек, который понимает и исправит эту проблему.

Об игре:

Очень хорошая игра. Не встречал никаких багов. Игровой движок дает нам очень хорошую картину. Физика в игре сделана на самом высоком уровне.

I was born in 1967. My name is Owen and my mother's name was Beth and my father's name was Stefan. My mother was a house wife while my father worked in the coal mines down town. We lived in Adelaide and for most of our lives we were a happy family. I had two siblings, both brothers. One day, my older brother passed away, shortly after my father died. It was a very melancholy period of time for the whole family and struggled to survive. One day, my younger brother came back from school. He has a paper bag filled with something which he shook around. It sounded like a bunch of pebbles or something small and in large capacity. He came and offer me some of the contents of the bag. It was nuts (as in the food). I had never before had nuts and I asked how he got a hang of them since at the time they were quite expensive and we didn't have the capital to afford such a luxury. He said he got them from his friend Deez. I then asked, who Deez was. Ever since that day I have lived in a constant state of misery and despair, wishing that I had the strength to take my own life, but I am far too weak.

Counter-Strike: Global Offensive is my favorite modern-day competitive shooter on Steam right now. For obvious reasons Counter Strike has been at the forefront of the FPS industry for decades and CSGO has continued that narrative for many years now.

With the latest update for casual game modes, shorter match times, and some other quality of life fixes I think 2021 is as good of a time to jump in as ever. Between competitive matchmaking, casual games, and workshop maps (which might be an underrated enjoyment to the game like forge for Halo) you definitely won't regret logging endless hours into this game.

I have a few words to say about this cock and balls torture simulator disguised as a game. 
Your first 50 hours of this game will be riddled by nothing but pure rage as you encounter mainly cheaters and teammates so toxic that the Chernobly reactor 4 looks like an air refreshner besides them. 
Once you actually think youre getting good after 500 hours or so, valve matchmaking says "We dont like you, we dont like your dog or your family, here enjoy playing against faken Fnatic all stars. 
Once you start thinking you can carry your team solo, the first thing you hear once you join a match is Privyet 4X.... seriously, the "mute my team" option is the most useful option in the game. 
Another tip... DONT SPEND MONEY ON CASES. Ive spent the GDP of Nigeria on cases and the best i won was a 0.48E field tested glock skin. 
Overall... the second you play the first two matches, thats it... youve lost everything, seriously, forgot about everything else, this game is so addictive that it makes heroin look like green tea. 
Still... the fun you experience, and the feeling when you realize youre actually getting better is irreplacable. 
This game has given me nothing but pain, and you should definitely not play it

Just got CS GO today! AWP seems very OP...

Hello folks, just got the game today from the steam sale. Not completely new to CS, I've owned CSS for a few years now but only because it was on sale bundled with gmod which is what I was really after, though still a fun game that I'd play a few times a month.

Once thing I've noticed about almost every CSS server I've played on is every sniper but the Scout is banned, for good reason I thought since when I went into servers where they weren't banned no one was using anything but these weapons (mostly the AWP). In a game about making twitch precision headshots, the AWP seems to break it since you don't need to be very precise with it at all.

My experience with the AWP in CSS is actually why I've put off buying CS GO for so long. I knew that you get into most games through matchmaking meaning you have to deal with AWPS, and I feared most games would be reduced to everyone using AWPS vs everyone using AWPS, with people not using AWPS gettings shit on unless they're miles better than the enemy team. I ended up buying the game anyway today though since it's cheap and very popular.

Turns out my fears were completely justified. The AWP completely breaks the game. All skill goes out the window once you can afford an AWP, just take a seat and anyone who approaches you instantly dies. Honestly I'm really disappointing and I'm already starting to regret this purchase, since I have a lot more fun in CSS where there are mostly no AWPS.

Does anyone else feel the same way about this weapon? I feel like the game would be so much better off without it. This one weapon is so game breaking that most CSS servers ban it, and this single weapon alone being legal has discouraged me from buying this entire game. I'm sure at the top 5% of play AWPS are balanced and natural part of the game... and CS elitists are going to have a field day with my "noobish" complaints, but honestly I don't give a shit :\ because 95% of players aren't the top 5%.

Si hay algo por lo que Counter-Strike ha destacado tantísimo y sigue siendo tan reconocido, es por ser un juego de habilidad al 100%. Aquí no hay lugar para el factor suerte, obviamente dejando de lado al timing. El juego siempre ofrece las mismas herramientas a todos los jugadores, por lo que al final casi siempre acaban ganando los que mejor saben jugar. Olvídense de cualquier FPS moderno y todas sus innovaciones. Aquí las horas de juego se traducen en más experiencia "real", somos mejores porque al jugar más hemos aprendido sus mecánicas, el funcionamiento de las armas y los puntos estratégicos del mapa, pensar en lo que puede o no puede hacer el enemigo, no porque un sistema nos dé ventajas artificiales.

Para los nuevos jugadores, les digo que si juegan este nuevo campo de batalla y vienen de otros Shooters actuales como Call of Duty, lo mejor que pueden hacer es olvidar todo lo que han aprendido en esos juegos. Aquí se dispara desde la cadera y si quieres apuntar solo podrás hacerlo con las armas que tengan zoom; no hay regeneración de vida automática, por lo que todo el daño que recibamos será permanente, y no existen reapariciones, por lo que si nos matan no volveremos a la acción hasta la siguiente ronda (dejando dm y carrera de armamento de lado)

Básicamente, el juego nos propone unirnos al equipo de los terroristas (tt) o al de los anti-terroristas (ct). Dependiendo del mapa en el que nos encontremos, los terroristas tendrán que poner una bomba y detonarla o los anti-terroristas tendrán que rescatar a unos rehenes. Todo esto dentro del límite de tiempo fijado. Para ganar tenemos o que cumplir el objetivo o matar a todo el equipo contrario. Fácil, simple de entender, y con una profundidad jugable que ha marcado una época.


Si vamos correteando por ahí disparando a lo loco y contando con que acertaremos alguna bala, acabaremos muertos una y otra vez. Si queremos sobrevivir tendremos que estar constantemente pendientes del radar, jugar en equipo con el resto de nuestros compañeros, saber que si llevamos el cuchillo correremos más, tender emboscadas para agarrar por sorpresa, ser conscientes de que cuando estemos agachados mejoramos nuestra precisión, calcular muy bien cuando recargar, etc.

Además, cada ronda iremos ganando dinero, ya sea por matar rivales, ganar, perder, rescatar rehenes o desactivar bombas. Esto nos servirá para comprar armas y equipo en una tienda (la cual ahora presenta un aspecto radial para facilitar su uso con un mando) que hay en el punto de salida de cada equipo. Esto añade cierto valor estratégico, ya que tendremos qué decidir en qué gastar nuestros billetes en cada ronda. Además, si morimos, perderemos todo lo que hayamos adquirido, por lo que sobrevivir a cada asalto se convierte en algo todavía más valioso y que nos empuja a no cometer locuras y a medir bien nuestros movimientos.

Overall rating: 6/10.

The bottom four ranks of this game's matchmaking are more difficult than the top four ranks. Ranking up and down is also completely broken; my record is 13 wins consecutively with no rank up, keeping in mind each match is usually at least 45 minutes long. I used to love this game, its probably my most played game, but now its an unenjoyable experience all-together. The game with the largest and most view pro-league has quite possibly the worst ranking system for its amateur players. I have around 200 hours in siege and am ranked high platinum, yet have never made it past nova master in cs. This has turned into a rant, so in conclusion, if you like smurfs and a completely unfriendly player base, this is the game for you.

The game pits two teams, Terrorists and Counter-Terrorists, against each other in different objective-based game modes. The most common game modes involve the Terrorists planting a bomb while Counter-Terrorists attempt to stop them, or Counter-Terrorists attempting to rescue hostages that the Terrorists have captured. There are nine official game modes, all of which have distinct characteristics specific to that mode. The game also has matchmaking support that allows players to play on dedicated Valve servers, in addition to community-hosted servers with custom maps and game modes. A battle-royale game-mode, "Danger Zone", was introduced in December 2018.

The ideas behind Counter-Strike in general are great, but it's pretty obvious that this game can't ever live up to its potential.

1. The ranking system is broken. See the Leetify graphs of NA rank distribution. With a positive win rate, I'm still deranking, even on one loss after a winstreak. Back in 2015, the system pushed everyone to the top ranks; now in 2021, we're all being pushed to the lower ranks.
2. Cheaters are all over the place. This is the worst it's ever been. I have never seen a worse state of CSGO. The anticheat systems don't clean the game up. You run into match after match of blatant cheaters. It does not feel like the exception; it feels like the rule. Indeed, some days I haven't even had a clean match based on how many of my prior matches have a convicted cheater in them. You have to play 3rd party (ie. FACEIT) in order to have a chance at cleaner games, but even then I've run into obvious wallers.

[b]TL;DR: I do NOT recommend CSGO anymore in its current state. Do NOT spend anymore money on this game unless you're fine with the status quo. It's a terrible experience for new players, and the veterans are hanging on to their memories of what it used to be.[/b]

I'm sorry but CS:GO is no longer fun for me after nearly 3k hours (yes I know that's a long time. However, a majority of that time spent has been in casual matches due to only being able to solo queue). As for the game itself it can be good fun just to dive straight into a server and get the satisfaction of tapping heads.

However for both casual and competitive matches [i]it really is[/i] no place for anyone wanting to queue solo and, of course, it can be the same for other multiplayer games but not as bad as this game; that's for sure. As a prime example you most definitely and unfortunately will come across a player that will cheat as well as players that may not understand English which makes it a worse experience since communication is [b]key[/b] to truly work together as a team.

In addition to that, you may also either be matched up with players who are unfriendly and not showing good sportsmanship which only encourages negative mentality and stops you from fully focusing on the match.

Also I would like to mention, and I'm sure many people know this already, that this game also contains quite a few bugs such as not being able to hit a player whilst standing still and / or crouching aiming at their head. In other words, it's not consistently smooth gameplay.

[b]My advice to anyone wanting to play this game is only do so if you absolutely want to take it seriously and [i]really[/i] wanting to improve your overall performance whilst queuing with at least maybe 3 friends that you know well enough then move onto playing on 128-tick servers on 3rd party services such as FaceIt and / or ESEA.[/b]

Game is overall a great game depending on many factors, which i will go over in this review. To start with this isn't a game you can just jump into and be #1, it takes a lot of practice, time and commitment. Overall i've played this game for 2,400+ hours combined between my multiple accounts. I have personally loved this game for what it has to offer and have always been a fan of the game-mode and the genre of the game.

I will be going over the positives and negatives in this review as well as summing it up at the end with my overall thoughts and opinions. I will admit this game isn't for the light hearted, as the community is a fairly toxic but also pleasant community. I have made many friends but also dealt with a lot of childish players within this game. You will be able to make friends quite easily and play with them constantly making it easier to rank up as your playing with people you can communicate with rather then random people.

There are a few key points to this game that make it amazing those are, team work, communication, skill, knowledge and memory. Team work is a vital part of this game and is what makes it amazing, it's a lot harder to win when you aren't playing as a team, any great team requires great communication, communication is an important part, as well as knowing what to call and when to call it. This game requires some skill, at the higher levels a lot more skill. This doesn't necessarily mean you need to be the best, as there are ranks in competitive for a reason to assign you to people in similar ranks, although there are smurfs and cheaters as with any competitive game. Knowledge and memory go together, can't have one without the other in this game, you need to be knowledgeable in how to peek, where to peek, how to peek together and more similar situations, to top it off you also need good memory in where to smoke, how to smoke certain positions, as well as flashbangs and other utilities.

In saying that, that is mainly only the competitive side of this game, there are many other amazing features offered in this game, those being community servers, arms races, demolition, casual and other gamemodes. This game has a lot to offer, in particular one of my favourite parts of this game is the community servers, you have surf servers, and game servers, making it a game for everyone.

If you are feeling like taking your gaming to the next level i would highly recommend this game, there are many leagues to join i.e FaceIT and similar. There is also the pro scene which many make it to in different divisions, this allows for the best of the best to play for cash and other rewards.

This game has no real pay to win features besides when the game requires you to now pay for prime, which is totally worth it! There are skins, but those do not have any advantage besides player models which can make it harder to see the person which is playing.

Now i will give you all a lovely bullet point list of what this has to offer quickly ran down with negatives and positives below:

The Negatives:
1) The Community - This will be featured in both areas, as it is a downfall and a positive, the community can be quite toxic but also quite welcoming.
2) Learning Curve - There is a learning curve for this game, so don't expect to jump in and be rambo.
3) The Cheaters - This comes with any game, but in this game there is a chance you will run into cheaters quite frequently.

The Positives:
1) Amazing Game - This game is always going to be a top game and very popular at that.
2) Requires Co-operation - This game i personally enjoy for the fact it requires the team to work as a team.
3) Fun Combat - The guns have recoil patterns to learn, getting a good one tap is quite fun. Overall combat is a great aspect of this game.
4) Top Selling Game - This game is a top selling game for a reason, allowing all sorts of players from all over to play an amazing FPS.

Thats the good and bad quickly summed up, i will be updating this review as time goes on. I hope you all enjoyed and if you have any questions feel free to leave them below and I will get to you as soon as i can. If you are looking for a game to have some fun then this is the game for you, aslong as you know what your in for. Hope you all have a lovely day and keep on fragging!

While I have a lot of love for CS:GO, and have spent a good amount of time playing, I seriously have a hard time recommending it to anyone [i] new [/i]. The game has a serious and ongoing hacker and smurfing problem, and even if someone isn't cheating, it's hard to play against anyone good without seriously questioning if they are using some kind of third party cheat. The game is fun to play about half of the time.

I am definitely no where near top skill in this game, I only place GN, but it's hard to play competitively or even just for fun at all anymore when you always have to live in fear of someone cheating the system to ruin your day. While obviously not every match you place into is going to have a cheater or a smurf, after playing for long such matches appear enough to tarnish the whole experience.

I still won't recommend you play Valorant though.

I started playing CSGO a while back and basically play war games to get the yearly badge.  I'm not the greatest and I know there are players better than me, but when you have a player running up the stairs and they shoot you while their back is to you and kill you, something is going on.  Or you have another player who takes on 3 players of the enemy team and mows them down like nothing and continues playing.  Also, the AFKers who are continually dragged from one match to another (and no, they aren't turning in circles, they are just standing there) and their friends won't kick them, something needs to be done about this.

But the worse thing is the people with a high ping (over 150 or more) when the rest of the players are at 15-40 ping.  Why are these people even allowed to join these matches.  Also, with all the thousands of people in this game, why do I continually get placed with the same 7-10 players where I can't get kills because either my teammates or the other team are getting 16 - 22 headshots or more?  I left the game once and didn't play for six months, but I'm just after the badge, but finding it may not be worth it as Valve's anti-cheat isn't very effective.

Question to Steam support:

Hello. Please tell me how I can accomplish achievements: 1) Veteran of map Aztec, 2) Veteran of map Dust , 3) Veteran of map Shorttrain, 4) This Glass World, 5) Sniper, 6) Tourist when you removed these 3 maps, thereby making these achievements unworkable. I hope to hear an adequate answer from you, since I really do not understand what the problem is: you have deleted maps, delete achievements, do not want to delete achievements, add maps back. + The game is actively supported by developers, updates are coming out. I encounter such a problem for the first time and for my understanding it is nonsense when game developers remove game content so plus tied to achievements. I perform all games on 100% ONLY HONESTLY and how can I perform these achievements when they are broken?

Answer from Steam support:

We are currently aware that certain achievements are no longer able to be obtained due to the maps being removed from the game. Unfortunately, we cannot provide a workaround for obtaining these achievements but I have forwarded your concerns on this matter onto the CS:GO team so they're aware. 

Please let us know if you have any other questions or issues that we may assist you with.

My opinion:

The developer has done nothing since 2017 when they have broken these 6 achievement. Maybe it is new fashion, break something that is working good. I want you to know only one thing if you ignore the quality of your project remember that this is the way to nowhere. I hope that there is at least 1 person in your development team who understands and will correct this problem.

About the game:

The very good game. Didn't meet any bugs. The game engine gives us the very good picture. Physic in the game done on highest level.

Вопрос к Steam support:

Здравствуйте. Скажите пожалуйста, как я могу выполнить достижения: 1) Ветеран карты Aztec, 2) Ветеран карты Dust, 3) Ветеран карты Shorttrain, 4) Этот стеклянный мир, 5) Снайпер, 6) Турист, когда Вы удалили эти 3 карты, тем самым сделали нерабочими эти достижения. Надеюсь услышать от Вас адекватный ответ, так как мне собственно вообще не понятно в чем проблема: удалили карты, удаляйте достижения, не хотите удалять достижения, добавляйте карты назад. + Игра активно поддерживается разработчиками, выходят обновления. С такой проблемой я сталкиваюсь впервые и для моего понимания это нонсенс когда разработчики игры удаляют игровой контент так плюс привязанный к достижениям. Я выполняю все игры на 100% ТОЛЬКО ЧЕСТНЫМ ПУТЕМ и как я могу выполнить эти достижения когда они сломаны?

Ответ от Steam support:

В настоящее время мы знаем, что некоторые достижения больше не могут быть получены из-за удаления карт из игры. К сожалению, мы не можем предоставить обходной путь для получения этих достижений, но я направил ваши опасения по этому вопросу в команду CS: GO, чтобы они знали.

Пожалуйста, дайте нам знать, если у вас есть какие-либо другие вопросы или проблемы, с которыми мы можем вам помочь.

Мое мнение:

Разработчик ничего не делал с 2017 года, когда они сломали эти 6 достижений. Может, это новая мода, сломать то, что работает хорошо. Я хочу, чтобы вы знали только одно, если вы игнорируете качество вашего проекта помните, что это путь в никуда. Надеюсь, что в вашей команде разработчиков есть хотя бы 1 человек, который понимает и исправит эту проблему.

Об игре:

Очень хорошая игра. Не встречал никаких багов. Игровой движок дает нам очень хорошую картину. Физика в игре сделана на самом высоком уровне.

I was born in 1967. My name is Owen and my mother's name was Beth and my father's name was Stefan. My mother was a house wife while my father worked in the coal mines down town. We lived in Adelaide and for most of our lives we were a happy family. I had two siblings, both brothers. One day, my older brother passed away, shortly after my father died. It was a very melancholy period of time for the whole family and struggled to survive. One day, my younger brother came back from school. He has a paper bag filled with something which he shook around. It sounded like a bunch of pebbles or something small and in large capacity. He came and offer me some of the contents of the bag. It was nuts (as in the food). I had never before had nuts and I asked how he got a hang of them since at the time they were quite expensive and we didn't have the capital to afford such a luxury. He said he got them from his friend Deez. I then asked, who Deez was. Ever since that day I have lived in a constant state of misery and despair, wishing that I had the strength to take my own life, but I am far too weak.

Counter-Strike: Global Offensive is my favorite modern-day competitive shooter on Steam right now. For obvious reasons Counter Strike has been at the forefront of the FPS industry for decades and CSGO has continued that narrative for many years now.

With the latest update for casual game modes, shorter match times, and some other quality of life fixes I think 2021 is as good of a time to jump in as ever. Between competitive matchmaking, casual games, and workshop maps (which might be an underrated enjoyment to the game like forge for Halo) you definitely won't regret logging endless hours into this game.

I have a few words to say about this cock and balls torture simulator disguised as a game. 
Your first 50 hours of this game will be riddled by nothing but pure rage as you encounter mainly cheaters and teammates so toxic that the Chernobly reactor 4 looks like an air refreshner besides them. 
Once you actually think youre getting good after 500 hours or so, valve matchmaking says "We dont like you, we dont like your dog or your family, here enjoy playing against faken Fnatic all stars. 
Once you start thinking you can carry your team solo, the first thing you hear once you join a match is Privyet 4X.... seriously, the "mute my team" option is the most useful option in the game. 
Another tip... DONT SPEND MONEY ON CASES. Ive spent the GDP of Nigeria on cases and the best i won was a 0.48E field tested glock skin. 
Overall... the second you play the first two matches, thats it... youve lost everything, seriously, forgot about everything else, this game is so addictive that it makes heroin look like green tea. 
Still... the fun you experience, and the feeling when you realize youre actually getting better is irreplacable. 
This game has given me nothing but pain, and you should definitely not play it

Just got CS GO today! AWP seems very OP...

Hello folks, just got the game today from the steam sale. Not completely new to CS, I've owned CSS for a few years now but only because it was on sale bundled with gmod which is what I was really after, though still a fun game that I'd play a few times a month.

Once thing I've noticed about almost every CSS server I've played on is every sniper but the Scout is banned, for good reason I thought since when I went into servers where they weren't banned no one was using anything but these weapons (mostly the AWP). In a game about making twitch precision headshots, the AWP seems to break it since you don't need to be very precise with it at all.

My experience with the AWP in CSS is actually why I've put off buying CS GO for so long. I knew that you get into most games through matchmaking meaning you have to deal with AWPS, and I feared most games would be reduced to everyone using AWPS vs everyone using AWPS, with people not using AWPS gettings shit on unless they're miles better than the enemy team. I ended up buying the game anyway today though since it's cheap and very popular.

Turns out my fears were completely justified. The AWP completely breaks the game. All skill goes out the window once you can afford an AWP, just take a seat and anyone who approaches you instantly dies. Honestly I'm really disappointing and I'm already starting to regret this purchase, since I have a lot more fun in CSS where there are mostly no AWPS.

Does anyone else feel the same way about this weapon? I feel like the game would be so much better off without it. This one weapon is so game breaking that most CSS servers ban it, and this single weapon alone being legal has discouraged me from buying this entire game. I'm sure at the top 5% of play AWPS are balanced and natural part of the game... and CS elitists are going to have a field day with my "noobish" complaints, but honestly I don't give a shit :\ because 95% of players aren't the top 5%.

Si hay algo por lo que Counter-Strike ha destacado tantísimo y sigue siendo tan reconocido, es por ser un juego de habilidad al 100%. Aquí no hay lugar para el factor suerte, obviamente dejando de lado al timing. El juego siempre ofrece las mismas herramientas a todos los jugadores, por lo que al final casi siempre acaban ganando los que mejor saben jugar. Olvídense de cualquier FPS moderno y todas sus innovaciones. Aquí las horas de juego se traducen en más experiencia "real", somos mejores porque al jugar más hemos aprendido sus mecánicas, el funcionamiento de las armas y los puntos estratégicos del mapa, pensar en lo que puede o no puede hacer el enemigo, no porque un sistema nos dé ventajas artificiales.

Para los nuevos jugadores, les digo que si juegan este nuevo campo de batalla y vienen de otros Shooters actuales como Call of Duty, lo mejor que pueden hacer es olvidar todo lo que han aprendido en esos juegos. Aquí se dispara desde la cadera y si quieres apuntar solo podrás hacerlo con las armas que tengan zoom; no hay regeneración de vida automática, por lo que todo el daño que recibamos será permanente, y no existen reapariciones, por lo que si nos matan no volveremos a la acción hasta la siguiente ronda (dejando dm y carrera de armamento de lado)

Básicamente, el juego nos propone unirnos al equipo de los terroristas (tt) o al de los anti-terroristas (ct). Dependiendo del mapa en el que nos encontremos, los terroristas tendrán que poner una bomba y detonarla o los anti-terroristas tendrán que rescatar a unos rehenes. Todo esto dentro del límite de tiempo fijado. Para ganar tenemos o que cumplir el objetivo o matar a todo el equipo contrario. Fácil, simple de entender, y con una profundidad jugable que ha marcado una época.


Si vamos correteando por ahí disparando a lo loco y contando con que acertaremos alguna bala, acabaremos muertos una y otra vez. Si queremos sobrevivir tendremos que estar constantemente pendientes del radar, jugar en equipo con el resto de nuestros compañeros, saber que si llevamos el cuchillo correremos más, tender emboscadas para agarrar por sorpresa, ser conscientes de que cuando estemos agachados mejoramos nuestra precisión, calcular muy bien cuando recargar, etc.

Además, cada ronda iremos ganando dinero, ya sea por matar rivales, ganar, perder, rescatar rehenes o desactivar bombas. Esto nos servirá para comprar armas y equipo en una tienda (la cual ahora presenta un aspecto radial para facilitar su uso con un mando) que hay en el punto de salida de cada equipo. Esto añade cierto valor estratégico, ya que tendremos qué decidir en qué gastar nuestros billetes en cada ronda. Además, si morimos, perderemos todo lo que hayamos adquirido, por lo que sobrevivir a cada asalto se convierte en algo todavía más valioso y que nos empuja a no cometer locuras y a medir bien nuestros movimientos.

The bottom four ranks of this game's matchmaking are more difficult than the top four ranks. Ranking up and down is also completely broken; my record is 13 wins consecutively with no rank up, keeping in mind each match is usually at least 45 minutes long. The game with the largest and most view pro-league has quite possibly the worst ranking system for its amateur players. I have around 200 hours in siege and am ranked high platinum, yet have never made it past nova master in cs. The game pits two teams, Terrorists and Counter-Terrorists, against each other in different objective-based game modes. The most common game modes involve the Terrorists planting a bomb while Counter-Terrorists attempt to stop them, or Counter-Terrorists attempting to rescue hostages that the Terrorists have captured. There are nine official game modes, all of which have distinct characteristics specific to that mode. The game also has matchmaking support that allows players to play on dedicated Valve servers, in addition to community-hosted servers with custom maps and game modes. A battle-royale game-mode, "Danger Zone", was introduced in December 2018.

Honestly a great game. Mechanics dialed in and game optimised for fair gameplay on most maps. Gun play and grenades can be chill or you can really learn and practice recoil and nade lineups. P.S. The 2 things that made me a better player is lowering my sensitivity to around 1000 eDPI (DPI multiplied by in-game sens) and learning crosshair placement. Also, never hold an angle super tight. Always anticipate an enemy running out, and by the time you react, they have already left your crosshair.

The ideas behind Counter-Strike in general are great, but it's pretty obvious that this game can't ever live up to its potential.

1. The ranking system is broken. See the Leetify graphs of NA rank distribution. With a positive win rate, I'm still deranking, even on one loss after a winstreak. Back in 2015, the system pushed everyone to the top ranks; now in 2021, we're all being pushed to the lower ranks.
2. Cheaters are all over the place. This is the worst it's ever been. I have never seen a worse state of CSGO. The anticheat systems don't clean the game up. You run into match after match of blatant cheaters. It does not feel like the exception; it feels like the rule. Indeed, some days I haven't even had a clean match based on how many of my prior matches have a convicted cheater in them. You have to play 3rd party (ie. FACEIT) in order to have a chance at cleaner games, but even then I've run into obvious wallers.

[b]TL;DR: I do NOT recommend CSGO anymore in its current state. Do NOT spend anymore money on this game unless you're fine with the status quo. It's a terrible experience for new players, and the veterans are hanging on to their memories of what it used to be.[/b]

I'm sorry but CS:GO is no longer fun for me after nearly 3k hours (yes I know that's a long time. However, a majority of that time spent has been in casual matches due to only being able to solo queue). As for the game itself it can be good fun just to dive straight into a server and get the satisfaction of tapping heads.

However for both casual and competitive matches [i]it really is[/i] no place for anyone wanting to queue solo and, of course, it can be the same for other multiplayer games but not as bad as this game; that's for sure. As a prime example you most definitely and unfortunately will come across a player that will cheat as well as players that may not understand English which makes it a worse experience since communication is [b]key[/b] to truly work together as a team.

In addition to that, you may also either be matched up with players who are unfriendly and not showing good sportsmanship which only encourages negative mentality and stops you from fully focusing on the match.

Also I would like to mention, and I'm sure many people know this already, that this game also contains quite a few bugs such as not being able to hit a player whilst standing still and / or crouching aiming at their head. In other words, it's not consistently smooth gameplay.

[b]My advice to anyone wanting to play this game is only do so if you absolutely want to take it seriously and [i]really[/i] wanting to improve your overall performance whilst queuing with at least maybe 3 friends that you know well enough then move onto playing on 128-tick servers on 3rd party services such as FaceIt and / or ESEA.[/b]

Game is overall a great game depending on many factors, which i will go over in this review. To start with this isn't a game you can just jump into and be #1, it takes a lot of practice, time and commitment. Overall i've played this game for 2,400+ hours combined between my multiple accounts. I have personally loved this game for what it has to offer and have always been a fan of the game-mode and the genre of the game.

I will be going over the positives and negatives in this review as well as summing it up at the end with my overall thoughts and opinions. I will admit this game isn't for the light hearted, as the community is a fairly toxic but also pleasant community. I have made many friends but also dealt with a lot of childish players within this game. You will be able to make friends quite easily and play with them constantly making it easier to rank up as your playing with people you can communicate with rather then random people.

There are a few key points to this game that make it amazing those are, team work, communication, skill, knowledge and memory. Team work is a vital part of this game and is what makes it amazing, it's a lot harder to win when you aren't playing as a team, any great team requires great communication, communication is an important part, as well as knowing what to call and when to call it. This game requires some skill, at the higher levels a lot more skill. This doesn't necessarily mean you need to be the best, as there are ranks in competitive for a reason to assign you to people in similar ranks, although there are smurfs and cheaters as with any competitive game. Knowledge and memory go together, can't have one without the other in this game, you need to be knowledgeable in how to peek, where to peek, how to peek together and more similar situations, to top it off you also need good memory in where to smoke, how to smoke certain positions, as well as flashbangs and other utilities.

In saying that, that is mainly only the competitive side of this game, there are many other amazing features offered in this game, those being community servers, arms races, demolition, casual and other gamemodes. This game has a lot to offer, in particular one of my favourite parts of this game is the community servers, you have surf servers, and game servers, making it a game for everyone.

If you are feeling like taking your gaming to the next level i would highly recommend this game, there are many leagues to join i.e FaceIT and similar. There is also the pro scene which many make it to in different divisions, this allows for the best of the best to play for cash and other rewards.

This game has no real pay to win features besides when the game requires you to now pay for prime, which is totally worth it! There are skins, but those do not have any advantage besides player models which can make it harder to see the person which is playing.

Now i will give you all a lovely bullet point list of what this has to offer quickly ran down with negatives and positives below:

The Negatives:
1) The Community - This will be featured in both areas, as it is a downfall and a positive, the community can be quite toxic but also quite welcoming.
2) Learning Curve - There is a learning curve for this game, so don't expect to jump in and be rambo.
3) The Cheaters - This comes with any game, but in this game there is a chance you will run into cheaters quite frequently.

The Positives:
1) Amazing Game - This game is always going to be a top game and very popular at that.
2) Requires Co-operation - This game i personally enjoy for the fact it requires the team to work as a team.
3) Fun Combat - The guns have recoil patterns to learn, getting a good one tap is quite fun. Overall combat is a great aspect of this game.
4) Top Selling Game - This game is a top selling game for a reason, allowing all sorts of players from all over to play an amazing FPS.

Thats the good and bad quickly summed up, i will be updating this review as time goes on. I hope you all enjoyed and if you have any questions feel free to leave them below and I will get to you as soon as i can. If you are looking for a game to have some fun then this is the game for you, aslong as you know what your in for. Hope you all have a lovely day and keep on fragging!

While I have a lot of love for CS:GO, and have spent a good amount of time playing, I seriously have a hard time recommending it to anyone [i] new [/i]. The game has a serious and ongoing hacker and smurfing problem, and even if someone isn't cheating, it's hard to play against anyone good without seriously questioning if they are using some kind of third party cheat. The game is fun to play about half of the time.

I am definitely no where near top skill in this game, I only place GN, but it's hard to play competitively or even just for fun at all anymore when you always have to live in fear of someone cheating the system to ruin your day. While obviously not every match you place into is going to have a cheater or a smurf, after playing for long such matches appear enough to tarnish the whole experience.

I still won't recommend you play Valorant though.

I started playing CSGO a while back and basically play war games to get the yearly badge.  I'm not the greatest and I know there are players better than me, but when you have a player running up the stairs and they shoot you while their back is to you and kill you, something is going on.  Or you have another player who takes on 3 players of the enemy team and mows them down like nothing and continues playing.  Also, the AFKers who are continually dragged from one match to another (and no, they aren't turning in circles, they are just standing there) and their friends won't kick them, something needs to be done about this.

But the worse thing is the people with a high ping (over 150 or more) when the rest of the players are at 15-40 ping.  Why are these people even allowed to join these matches.  Also, with all the thousands of people in this game, why do I continually get placed with the same 7-10 players where I can't get kills because either my teammates or the other team are getting 16 - 22 headshots or more?  I left the game once and didn't play for six months, but I'm just after the badge, but finding it may not be worth it as Valve's anti-cheat isn't very effective.

Question to Steam support:

Hello. Please tell me how I can accomplish achievements: 1) Veteran of map Aztec, 2) Veteran of map Dust , 3) Veteran of map Shorttrain, 4) This Glass World, 5) Sniper, 6) Tourist when you removed these 3 maps, thereby making these achievements unworkable. I hope to hear an adequate answer from you, since I really do not understand what the problem is: you have deleted maps, delete achievements, do not want to delete achievements, add maps back. + The game is actively supported by developers, updates are coming out. I encounter such a problem for the first time and for my understanding it is nonsense when game developers remove game content so plus tied to achievements. I perform all games on 100% ONLY HONESTLY and how can I perform these achievements when they are broken?

Answer from Steam support:

We are currently aware that certain achievements are no longer able to be obtained due to the maps being removed from the game. Unfortunately, we cannot provide a workaround for obtaining these achievements but I have forwarded your concerns on this matter onto the CS:GO team so they're aware. 

Please let us know if you have any other questions or issues that we may assist you with.

My opinion:

The developer has done nothing since 2017 when they have broken these 6 achievement. Maybe it is new fashion, break something that is working good. I want you to know only one thing if you ignore the quality of your project remember that this is the way to nowhere. I hope that there is at least 1 person in your development team who understands and will correct this problem.

About the game:

The very good game. Didn't meet any bugs. The game engine gives us the very good picture. Physic in the game done on highest level.

Вопрос к Steam support:

Здравствуйте. Скажите пожалуйста, как я могу выполнить достижения: 1) Ветеран карты Aztec, 2) Ветеран карты Dust, 3) Ветеран карты Shorttrain, 4) Этот стеклянный мир, 5) Снайпер, 6) Турист, когда Вы удалили эти 3 карты, тем самым сделали нерабочими эти достижения. Надеюсь услышать от Вас адекватный ответ, так как мне собственно вообще не понятно в чем проблема: удалили карты, удаляйте достижения, не хотите удалять достижения, добавляйте карты назад. + Игра активно поддерживается разработчиками, выходят обновления. С такой проблемой я сталкиваюсь впервые и для моего понимания это нонсенс когда разработчики игры удаляют игровой контент так плюс привязанный к достижениям. Я выполняю все игры на 100% ТОЛЬКО ЧЕСТНЫМ ПУТЕМ и как я могу выполнить эти достижения когда они сломаны?

Ответ от Steam support:

В настоящее время мы знаем, что некоторые достижения больше не могут быть получены из-за удаления карт из игры. К сожалению, мы не можем предоставить обходной путь для получения этих достижений, но я направил ваши опасения по этому вопросу в команду CS: GO, чтобы они знали.

Пожалуйста, дайте нам знать, если у вас есть какие-либо другие вопросы или проблемы, с которыми мы можем вам помочь.

Мое мнение:

Разработчик ничего не делал с 2017 года, когда они сломали эти 6 достижений. Может, это новая мода, сломать то, что работает хорошо. Я хочу, чтобы вы знали только одно, если вы игнорируете качество вашего проекта помните, что это путь в никуда. Надеюсь, что в вашей команде разработчиков есть хотя бы 1 человек, который понимает и исправит эту проблему.

Об игре:

Очень хорошая игра. Не встречал никаких багов. Игровой движок дает нам очень хорошую картину. Физика в игре сделана на самом высоком уровне.

I was born in 1967. My name is Owen and my mother's name was Beth and my father's name was Stefan. My mother was a house wife while my father worked in the coal mines down town. We lived in Adelaide and for most of our lives we were a happy family. I had two siblings, both brothers. One day, my older brother passed away, shortly after my father died. It was a very melancholy period of time for the whole family and struggled to survive. One day, my younger brother came back from school. He has a paper bag filled with something which he shook around. It sounded like a bunch of pebbles or something small and in large capacity. He came and offer me some of the contents of the bag. It was nuts (as in the food). I had never before had nuts and I asked how he got a hang of them since at the time they were quite expensive and we didn't have the capital to afford such a luxury. He said he got them from his friend Deez. I then asked, who Deez was. Ever since that day I have lived in a constant state of misery and despair, wishing that I had the strength to take my own life, but I am far too weak.

I have a few words to say about this cock and balls torture simulator disguised as a game. 
Your first 50 hours of this game will be riddled by nothing but pure rage as you encounter mainly cheaters and teammates so toxic that the Chernobly reactor 4 looks like an air refreshner besides them. 
Once you actually think youre getting good after 500 hours or so, valve matchmaking says "We dont like you, we dont like your dog or your family, here enjoy playing against faken Fnatic all stars. 
Once you start thinking you can carry your team solo, the first thing you hear once you join a match is Privyet 4X.... seriously, the "mute my team" option is the most useful option in the game. 
Another tip... DONT SPEND MONEY ON CASES. Ive spent the GDP of Nigeria on cases and the best i won was a 0.48E field tested glock skin.
